    Ngme2 Configuration in OS X Ngme2 Models

    The Inverse-Gamma (IGam) Distribution

    igam.Rd

    Density, distribution function, quantile function and random generation for the inverse-Gamma distribution with parameters a and b.

    Usage

    digam(x, a, b, log = FALSE)

rigam(n, a, b)

pigam(q, a, b, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE)

qigam(p, a, b, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE)

    Arguments

    x, q

    vector of quantiles.

    a, b

    parameters a and b. Must be positive.

    log, log.p

    logical; if TRUE, probabilities/densities \(p\) are returned as \(log(p)\).

    n,

    number of observations.

    lower.tail

    logical; if TRUE, probabilities are \(P[X\leq x]\), otherwise, \(P[X>x]\).

    p

    vector of probabilities.

    Value

    digam gives the density, pigam gives the distribution function, qigam gives the quantile function, and rigam generates random deviates.

    Invalid arguments will result in return value NaN, with a warning.

    The length of the result is determined by n for rig.

    Details

    The inverse-Gamma distribution has density given by $$f(x; a, b) = \frac{b^a}{\Gamma(a)}x^{a-1}\exp( -\frac{b}{x}),$$ where \(x>0\) and \(a,b>0\).

    See also

    dnig, dgig

    Examples

    rigam(100, a = 1, b = 1)
#>   [1]   0.3030100   4.7714713   2.2126665   7.0292906   2.7119484   8.3519753
#>   [7]   1.2754898   2.0189555   0.2828969   0.5764821   2.1326435 553.6914359
#>  [13]   5.9306696   8.8425408   0.8834479   0.8985617   0.9554425   5.1953096
#>  [19]   1.1937016   0.2567596   0.2742420  10.1359519   2.3979187   0.7760053
#>  [25]   1.9879585   1.0456200   2.9738336   4.8062998   0.4107620  10.2704815
#>  [31]   0.5743438   1.1837103   0.9270684   5.0886522   5.7323932   0.5947303
#>  [37]   0.9316225   3.2761731  10.7689354   1.1888501   9.2302447   7.2381252
#>  [43]   0.4412283  32.8409438   2.3636300  10.4377482   3.5838049   0.3074122
#>  [49]   8.5048663   0.3669098  20.0787847   1.3016494   4.9296740   3.6132016
#>  [55]   6.0051604   0.3254737   4.2202995   0.2926507   0.7735846   2.5366233
#>  [61]   1.1647340   1.0527388   2.6470199   0.2363926   0.4774060   9.7987197
#>  [67]   6.2746786   0.8732637   1.0566971   1.3103256   1.8297355   0.5504930
#>  [73]  10.2748829   1.6500025  15.0698422   0.4791688  13.0618031   0.7493715
#>  [79]   1.8136159   1.2747957   2.1506603  11.8681119   2.9673696   0.5705029
#>  [85]   7.8698064  14.8771482   2.1095752   0.6435993   0.5901839   2.9114712
#>  [91]   0.5376094   0.3205972   0.6312308   1.1498308   0.2662235   2.8205803
#>  [97]   1.8307086   1.2144059   6.3663098   0.7233918
pigam(0.4, a = 1, b = 1)
#> [1] 0.082085
qigam(0.8, a = 1, b = 1)
#> [1] 4.48142
plot(function(x){digam(x, a = 1, b = 1)}, main =
"Inverse-Gamma density", ylab = "Probability density",
xlim = c(0,10))
